Yes, there are ongoing efforts to preserve and promote the Malayalam language. One of the key organizations involved in these efforts is the Sahitya Akademi, which is a national academy of letters that promotes and popularizes Indian literature across different languages.

The government of Kerala has also taken many steps to support the language. Malayalam is the medium of instruction in the state's schools, and the government has launched initiatives to promote the study and use of Malayalam among young people.

There are also several cultural and literary organizations that work to promote the Malayalam language, such as the Kerala Sahitya Akademi, which is dedicated to the promotion of Malayalam literature and language.

In addition, there is a growing interest in using technology to preserve and promote the language. For instance, there are now several mobile apps that help people learn Malayalam, and online resources such as e-books, videos, and audio recordings are becoming increasingly popular.

Overall, there are many ongoing efforts to promote and preserve the Malayalam language, and these efforts are an important part of ensuring that the language continues to thrive and evolve in the future.
